channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Genome-AC-GAN: Enhancing Synthetic Genotype Generation through Auxiliary Classification
item.description: We conducted experiments to evaluate the performance of the Genome-AC-GAN and compare the AGs it generates with real genomic data as well as with AGs generated by previously published methods.

item.title: https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/10438484
item.description: Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) can capture local context information well but cannot model the global dependencies.

item.title: TEXTRON: Weakly Supervised Multilingual Text Detection through Data Programming
item.description: In order to solve this problem, we propose TEXTRON, a Data Programming-based approach, where users can plug various text detection methods into a weak supervision-based learning framework.

item.title: Visually Dehallucinative Instruction Generation: Know What You Don't Know
item.description: "When did the emperor Napoleon invented iPhone?"

item.title: ControlLM: Crafting Diverse Personalities for Language Models
item.description: This heightens the need to control model behaviors.

item.title: Unlocking Structure Measuring: Introducing PDD, an Automatic Metric for Positional Discourse Coherence
item.description: Recent large language models (LLMs) have shown remarkable performance in aligning generated text with user intentions across various tasks.

item.title: Criterion collapse and loss distribution control
item.description: In this work, we consider the notion of "criterion collapse," in which optimization of one metric implies optimality in another, with a particular focus on conditions for collapse into error probability minimizers under a wide variety of learning criteria, ranging from DRO and OCE risks (CVaR, tilted ERM) to non-monotonic criteria underlying recent ascent-descent algorithms explored in the literature (Flooding, SoftAD).

item.title: GeoEval: Benchmark for Evaluating LLMs and Multi-Modal Models on Geometry Problem-Solving
item.description: Yet, their proficiency in tackling geometry math problems, which necessitates an integrated understanding of both textual and visual information, has not been thoroughly evaluated.

item.title: TIAViz: A Browser-based Visualization Tool for Computational Pathology Models
item.description: Throughout the development of a machine learning (ML) model in digital pathology, it is crucial to have flexible, openly available tools to visualize models, from their outputs and predictions to the underlying annotations and images used to train or test a model.

item.title: QUICK: Quantization-aware Interleaving and Conflict-free Kernel for efficient LLM inference
item.description: We introduce QUICK, a group of novel optimized CUDA kernels for the efficient inference of quantized Large Language Models (LLMs).

item.title: FedLion: Faster Adaptive Federated Optimization with Fewer Communication
item.description: In Federated Learning (FL), a framework to train machine learning models across distributed data, well-known algorithms like FedAvg tend to have slow convergence rates, resulting in high communication costs during training.

item.title: Uncertainty Decomposition and Quantification for In-Context Learning of Large Language Models
item.description: Existing works have been devoted to quantifying the uncertainty in LLM's response, but they often overlook the complex nature of LLMs and the uniqueness of in-context learning.

item.title: A Trembling House of Cards? Mapping Adversarial Attacks against Language Agents
item.description: There is a surprisingly large gap between the speed and scale of their development and deployment and our understanding of their safety risks.

item.title: Best Arm Identification for Prompt Learning under a Limited Budget
item.description: Based on this connection, a general framework TRIPLE (besT aRm Identification for Prompt LEarning) is proposed to harness the power of BAI-FB in prompt learning systematically.

item.title: Generative Representational Instruction Tuning
item.description: Notably, we find that GRIT matches training on only generative or embedding data, thus we can unify both at no performance loss.

item.title: OpenMathInstruct-1: A 1.8 Million Math Instruction Tuning Dataset
item.description: Building on the recent progress in open-source LLMs, our proposed prompting novelty, and some brute-force scaling, we construct OpenMathInstruct-1, a math instruction tuning dataset with 1. 8M problem-solution pairs.

item.title: Selective Reflection-Tuning: Student-Selected Data Recycling for LLM Instruction-Tuning
item.description: Instruction tuning is critical to large language models (LLMs) for achieving better instruction following and task adaptation capabilities but its success heavily relies on the training data quality.

item.title: Textual Localization: Decomposing Multi-concept Images for Subject-Driven Text-to-Image Generation
item.description: Subject-driven text-to-image diffusion models empower users to tailor the model to new concepts absent in the pre-training dataset using a few sample images.

item.title: DE-COP: Detecting Copyrighted Content in Language Models Training Data
item.description: We are motivated by the premise that a language model is likely to identify verbatim excerpts from its training text.

item.title: MIM-Refiner: A Contrastive Learning Boost from Intermediate Pre-Trained Representations
item.description: The motivation behind MIM-Refiner is rooted in the insight that optimal representations within MIM models generally reside in intermediate layers.

item.title: Clifford Group Equivariant Simplicial Message Passing Networks
item.description: Experimental results show that our method is able to outperform both equivariant and simplicial graph neural networks on a variety of geometric tasks.

item.title: MC-DBN: A Deep Belief Network-Based Model for Modality Completion
item.description: Recent advancements in multi-modal artificial intelligence (AI) have revolutionized the fields of stock market forecasting and heart rate monitoring.

item.title: Predictors from causal features do not generalize better to new domains
item.description: Our goal is to test the hypothesis that models trained on causal features generalize better across domains.

item.title: Detecting CSV File Dialects by Table Uniformity Measurement and Data Type Inference
item.description: The human-readable simplicity with which the CSV format was devised, together with the absence of a standard that strictly defines this format, has allowed the proliferation of several variants in the dialects with which these files are written.

item.title: ViGEO: an Assessment of Vision GNNs in Earth Observation
item.description: Satellite missions and Earth Observation (EO) systems represent fundamental assets for environmental monitoring and the timely identification of catastrophic events, long-term monitoring of both natural resources and human-made assets, such as vegetation, water bodies, forests as well as buildings.

item.title: How to validate average calibration for machine learning regression tasks ?
item.description: Average calibration of the uncertainties of machine learning regression tasks can be tested in two ways.

item.title: Lester: rotoscope animation through video object segmentation and tracking
item.description: This article introduces Lester, a novel method to automatically synthetise retro-style 2D animations from videos.

item.title: Performative Reinforcement Learning in Gradually Shifting Environments
item.description: Unlike PRL, our framework allows to model scenarios where the environment gradually adjusts to a deployed policy.

item.title: BitDelta: Your Fine-Tune May Only Be Worth One Bit
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) are typically trained in two phases: pre-training on large internet-scale datasets, and fine-tuning for downstream tasks.

item.title: Bridging the Empirical-Theoretical Gap in Neural Network Formal Language Learning Using Minimum Description Length
item.description: Neural networks offer good approximation to many tasks but consistently fail to reach perfect generalization, even when theoretical work shows that such perfect solutions can be expressed by certain architectures.

item.title: QuRating: Selecting High-Quality Data for Training Language Models
item.description: Selecting high-quality pre-training data is important for creating capable language models, but existing methods rely on simple heuristics.

item.title: MM-Point: Multi-View Information-Enhanced Multi-Modal Self-Supervised 3D Point Cloud Understanding
item.description: In perception, multiple sensory information is integrated to map visual information from 2D views onto 3D objects, which is beneficial for understanding in 3D environments.

item.title: Multi-Word Tokenization for Sequence Compression
item.description: Large Language Models have proven highly successful at modelling a variety of tasks.

item.title: Unlocking the Potential of Transformers in Time Series Forecasting with Sharpness-Aware Minimization and Channel-Wise Attention
item.description: Transformer-based architectures achieved breakthrough performance in natural language processing and computer vision, yet they remain inferior to simpler linear baselines in multivariate long-term forecasting.

item.title: Data Engineering for Scaling Language Models to 128K Context
item.description: We demonstrate that continual pretraining of the full model on 1B-5B tokens of such data is an effective and affordable strategy for scaling the context length of language models to 128K.

item.title: Enhancing signal detectability in learning-based CT reconstruction with a model observer inspired loss function
item.description: Deep neural networks used for reconstructing sparse-view CT data are typically trained by minimizing a pixel-wise mean-squared error or similar loss function over a set of training images.

item.title: Extrapolation-Aware Nonparametric Statistical Inference
item.description: In this work, we extend the nonparametric statistical model to explicitly allow for extrapolation and introduce a class of extrapolation assumptions that can be combined with existing inference techniques to draw extrapolation-aware conclusions.

item.title: PAL: Proxy-Guided Black-Box Attack on Large Language Models
item.description: In this work, we introduce the Proxy-Guided Attack on LLMs (PAL), the first optimization-based attack on LLMs in a black-box query-only setting.

item.title: Risk-Sensitive Soft Actor-Critic for Robust Deep Reinforcement Learning under Distribution Shifts
item.description: We study the robustness of deep reinforcement learning algorithms against distribution shifts within contextual multi-stage stochastic combinatorial optimization problems from the operations research domain.

item.title: Answer is All You Need: Instruction-following Text Embedding via Answering the Question
item.description: This work aims to build a text embedder that can capture characteristics of texts specified by user instructions.

item.title: Radio-astronomical Image Reconstruction with Conditional Denoising Diffusion Model
item.description: Current techniques, such as CLEAN and PyBDSF, often fail to detect faint sources, highlighting the need for more accurate methods.

item.title: X-maps: Direct Depth Lookup for Event-based Structured Light Systems
item.description: We present a new approach to direct depth estimation for Spatial Augmented Reality (SAR) applications using event cameras.

item.title: Recovering the Pre-Fine-Tuning Weights of Generative Models
item.description: The dominant paradigm in generative modeling consists of two steps: i) pre-training on a large-scale but unsafe dataset, ii) aligning the pre-trained model with human values via fine-tuning.

item.title: COVIDHealth: A Benchmark Twitter Dataset and Machine Learning based Web Application for Classifying COVID-19 Discussions
item.description: In this study, our primary objective is to develop a machine learning-based web application for automatically classifying COVID-19-related discussions on social media.

item.title: Enhancing ID and Text Fusion via Alternative Training in Session-based Recommendation
item.description: To integrate text information, various methods have been introduced, mostly following a naive fusion framework.

item.title: Extreme Video Compression with Pre-trained Diffusion Models
item.description: The results showcase the potential of exploiting the temporal relations in video data using generative models.

item.title: Pyramid Attention Network for Medical Image Registration
item.description: The advent of deep-learning-based registration networks has addressed the time-consuming challenge in traditional iterative methods. However, the potential of current registration networks for comprehensively capturing spatial relationships has not been fully explored, leading to inadequate performance in large-deformation image registration. The pure convolutional neural networks (CNNs) neglect feature enhancement, while current Transformer-based networks are susceptible to information redundancy. To alleviate these issues, we propose a pyramid attention network (PAN) for deformable medical image registration. Specifically, the proposed PAN incorporates a dual-stream pyramid encoder with channel-wise attention to boost the feature representation. Moreover, a multi-head local attention Transformer is introduced as decoder to analyze motion patterns and generate deformation fields. Extensive experiments on two public brain magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) datasets and one abdominal MRI dataset demonstrate that our method achieves favorable registration performance, while outperforming several CNN-based and Transformer-based registration networks. Our code is publicly available at https://github. com/JuliusWang-7/PAN.

item.title: CLIP-MUSED: CLIP-Guided Multi-Subject Visual Neural Information Semantic Decoding
item.description: Although prior multi-subject decoding methods have made significant progress, they still suffer from several limitations, including difficulty in extracting global neural response features, linear scaling of model parameters with the number of subjects, and inadequate characterization of the relationship between neural responses of different subjects to various stimuli.

item.title: LogicPrpBank: A Corpus for Logical Implication and Equivalence
item.description: Logic reasoning has been critically needed in problem-solving and decision-making.

item.title: GraSSRep: Graph-Based Self-Supervised Learning for Repeat Detection in Metagenomic Assembly
item.description: Additionally, our experiments with synthetic metagenomic datasets reveal that incorporating the graph structure and the GNN enhances our detection performance.
